topic.title: Lyric Theatre
topic.shortdesc: This is my date idea for dramatic couples or those who want to visit a vintage Blacksburg staple.

section.title: About
section.p: Built in Downtown Blacksburg during the roaring 1920s, The Lyric Theatre is a luxurious historic movie theatre with a large screen, wooden stage, orchestra pit, and seating for nearly 500 people.

image.alt: The outside of a movie theater that reads the words "LYRIC" in bright yellow lettering on a maroon sign.

section.title: Review
section.p: I watched the 2023 Barbie movie here. Everything is so much bigger and better here than other movie theaters â€“ I felt fully immersed in the experience. Plus, knowing I was supporting a small local business felt sweet. If you choose your dates based on the ambiance, then this is the place for you.

section.title: Recommendation
section.p: The Lyric is typically open on weekends but may close early on weekdays without major movies showing, so plan for a weekend visit and check their website for showtimes. During the summer, the theater offers Free Movie Fridays, where they showcase a throwback film with free entry. Grab a large popcorn, strawberry licorice, and a cherry coke for that vintage feeling!
